str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From agapao; beloved.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From the present participle of pareimi; a being near, i.e. Advent; physically, aspect.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
Much, many; often.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Absence, deficiency, waste. From the participle of apeimi; a being away.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From kata and ergazomai; to work fully, i.e. Accomplish; by implication, to finish, fashion.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.
And, even, also, namely.
A trembling, quaking, fear. From tremo; a 'trembling', i.e. Quaking with fear.
